definitions.text: an imaginary person represented in a work of fiction (play or film or story)
examples: she is the main character in the novel

definitions.text: a characteristic property that defines the apparent individual nature of something
examples: each town has a quality all its own
the radical character of our demands

definitions.text: the inherent complex of attributes that determines a persons moral and ethical actions and reactions; - Herbert Spencer
examples: education has for its object the formation of character

definitions.text: an actor's portrayal of someone in a play
examples: she played the part of Desdemona

definitions.text: a person of a specified kind (usually with many eccentricities)

examples: he is a man of character

definitions.text: a formal recommendation by a former employer to a potential future employer describing the person's qualifications and dependability
examples: requests for character references are all too often answered evasively

definitions.text: a written symbol that is used to represent speech
(genetics) an attribute (structural or functional) that is determined by a gene or group of genes
